messages.name: Principal
messages.description: This is a GlobalGetable.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Principals are agnostic of the Authentication protocol that you use. In OAuth,
the id is retrieved by looking at the claims on the request. In mTLS, the
id is retrived by looking at the Subject Name of the client certificate.

fields.name: per_tenant_acls
fields.description:
Maps a Tenant ID to a list of ACL's that the Principal has permission to
execute *within that Tenant*
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: global_acls
fields.description: Sets permissions that this Principal has *for any Tenant* in the LH Cluster.

messages.name: Tenant
messages.description: This is a GlobalGetable

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Future versions will include quotas on a per-Tenant basis.

enums.name: LHErrorType
enums.description: This enum is all of the types of technical failure that can occur in a WfRun.

values.name: CHILD_FAILURE
values.description: A child ThreadRun failed with a technical ERROR.

values.name: VAR_SUB_ERROR
values.description: Failed substituting input variables into a NodeRun.

values.name: VAR_MUTATION_ERROR
values.description: Failed mutating variables after a NodeRun successfully completed.

values.name: USER_TASK_CANCELLED
values.description: A UserTaskRun was cancelled (EVOLVING: this will become a Business EXCEPTION)

values.name: TIMEOUT
values.description: A NodeRun failed due to a timeout.

values.name: TASK_FAILURE
values.description: A TaskRun failed due to an unexpected error.

values.name: VAR_ERROR
values.description: Wrapper for VAR_SUB_ERROR and VAR_MUTATION_ERROR

values.name: TASK_ERROR
values.description: Wrapper for TASK_FALIURE and TIMEOUT

values.name: INTERNAL_ERROR
values.description: An unexpected LittleHorse Internal error occurred. This is not expected to happen.

enums.name: LHStatus
enums.description: Status used for WfRun, ThreadRun, and NodeRun

enums.name: MetadataStatus
enums.description: Status of a Metadata Object, such as WfSpec or TaskDef

values.name: ACTIVE
values.description: ACTIVE means the object can be used.

values.name: ARCHIVED
values.description:
An ARCHIVED WfSpec can no longer be used to create new WfRun's, but
existing WfRun's will be allowed to run to completion.

values.name: TERMINATING
values.description:
A TERMINATING WfSpec is actively deleting all running WfRun's, and will
self-destruct once all of its child WfRun's are terminated.

values.name: TASK_SCHEDULED
values.description: Scheduled in the Task Queue but not yet picked up by a Task Worker.

values.name: TASK_RUNNING
values.description: Picked up by a Task Worker, but not yet reported or timed out.

values.name: TASK_SUCCESS
values.description: Successfully completed.

values.name: TASK_FAILED
values.description: Task Worker reported a technical failure while attempting to execute the TaskRun

values.name: TASK_TIMEOUT
values.description: Task Worker did not report a result in time.

values.name: TASK_OUTPUT_SERIALIZING_ERROR
values.description: Task Worker reported that it was unable to serialize the output of the TaskRun.

values.name: TASK_INPUT_VAR_SUB_ERROR
values.description:
Task Worker was unable to deserialize the input variables into appropriate language-specific
objects to pass into the Task Function

values.name: TASK_EXCEPTION
values.description: Task Function business logic determined that there was a business exception.

values.name: TASK_PENDING
values.description:
Refers to a TaskAttempt that is not yet scheduled. This happens when using retries
with an ExponentialBackoffRetryPolicy: the TaskAttempt isn't supposed to be scheduled
until it "matures", but it does already exist.

enums.name: VariableType
enums.description:
Type of a Varaible in LittleHorse. Corresponds to the possible value type's of a
VariableValue.

values.name: JSON_OBJ
values.description: An object represented as a json string.

values.name: JSON_ARR
values.description: A list represented as a json array string.

values.name: DOUBLE
values.description: A 64-bit floating point number.

values.name: BOOL
values.description: A boolean

values.name: STR
values.description: A string

values.name: INT
values.description: A 64-bit integer

values.name: BYTES
values.description: A byte array

enums.name: Comparator
enums.description: Operator for comparing two values to create a boolean expression.

values.name: LESS_THAN
values.description: Equivalent to `<`. Only valid for primitive types (no JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR).

values.name: GREATER_THAN
values.description: Equivalent to `>`. Only valid for primitive types (no JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR).

values.name: LESS_THAN_EQ
values.description: Equivalent to `<=`. Only valid for primitive types (no JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR).

values.name: GREATER_THAN_EQ
values.description: Equivalent to `>=`. Only valid for primitive types (no JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR).

values.name: EQUALS
values.description:
This is valid for any variable type, and is similar to .equals() in Java.

One note: if the RHS is a different type from the LHS, then LittleHorse will
try to cast the RHS to the same type as the LHS. If the cast fails, then the
ThreadRun fails with a VAR_SUB_ERROR.

values.name: NOT_EQUALS
values.description: This is the inverse of `EQUALS`

values.name: IN
values.description:
Only valid if the RHS is a JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR. Valid for any type on the LHS.

For the JSON_OBJ type, this returns true if the LHS is equal to a *KEY* in the
RHS. For the JSON_ARR type, it returns true if one of the elements of the RHS
is equal to the LHS.

values.name: NOT_IN
values.description: The inverse of IN.

enums.name: UTHook
enums.description: Enumerates the different lifecycle hooks that can cause the timer to start running.

values.name: ON_ARRIVAL
values.description:
The hook should be scheduled `delay_seconds` after the UserTaskRun is created. This
hook only causes the action to be scheduled once.

values.name: ON_TASK_ASSIGNED
values.description:
The hook should be scheduled `delay_seconds` after the ownership of the UserTaskRun
changes. This hook causes the Action to be scheduled one or more times. The first
time is scheduled when the UserTaskRun is created, since we treat the change from
"UserTaskRun is nonexistent" to "UserTaskRun is owned by a userId or userGroup" as
a change in ownership.

enums.name: VariableMutationType
enums.description: Enumerates the available operations to mutate a variable in a WfRun.

values.name: ASSIGN
values.description: Set the variable specified by the LHS to the value of the RHS.

values.name: ADD
values.description: Add the RHS to the LHS.

values.name: EXTEND
values.description: Append the RHS to the LHS (valid if the LHS is a STR or JSON_ARR)

values.name: SUBTRACT
values.description: Subtract the RHS from the LHS (both must be INT or DOUBLE)

values.name: MULTIPLY
values.description: Multiply the LHS by the RHS (both must be INT or DOUBLE)

values.name: DIVIDE
values.description: Divide the LHS by the RHS (both must be INT or DOUBLE)

values.name: REMOVE_IF_PRESENT
values.description: Remove any occurrences of RHS from LHS (LHS must be JSON_ARR)

values.name: REMOVE_INDEX
values.description: Remove item at index RHS from LHS (LHS must be JSON_ARR)

values.name: REMOVE_KEY
values.description: Remove the key specified by RHS from the LHS (LHS must be JSON_OBJ)

messages.name: ExponentialBackoffRetryPolicy
messages.description:
Defines an Exponential backoff policy for TaskRun retries. The delay for a retry
attempt `N` is defined as:

min(base_interval_ms * (multiplier ^(N-1)), max_delay_ms)

Note that timers in LittleHorse have a resolution of about 500-1000 milliseconds,
so timing is not exact.

fields.name: base_interval_ms
fields.description:
Base delay in ms for the first retry. Note that in LittleHorse, timers have a
resolution of 500-1000 milliseconds. Must be greater than zero.

fields.name: max_delay_ms
fields.description: Maximum delay in milliseconds between retries.

fields.name: multiplier
fields.description:
The multiplier to use in calculating the retry backoff policy. We recommend
starting with 2.0. Must be at least 1.0.

messages.name: TaskNode
messages.description: Defines a TaskRun execution. Used in a Node and also in the UserTask Trigger Actions.

fields.name: timeout_seconds
fields.description:
How long until LittleHorse determines that the Task Worker had a technical ERROR if
the worker does not yet reply to the Server. This is determined on a per-Attempt
basis.

fields.name: retries
fields.description:
Configures the amount of retries allowed on this TaskNode.

Retryable errors include:
- TASK_TIMEOUT: the TaskRun was started but the scheduler didn't hear back from the
  Task Worker in time.
- TASK_FAILED: the Task Worker reported an unexpected *technical* ERROR when executing
  the Task Function.

Other result codes are not retryable (including TASK_OUTPUT_SERIALIZING_ERROR,
TASK_INPUT_VAR_SUB_ERROR, and TASK_EXCEPTION).

fields.name: exponential_backoff
fields.description: If this field is set, then retries will use Exponential Backoff.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: variables
fields.description: Input variables into the TaskDef.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: UTActionTrigger
messages.description:
A UTActionTrigger triggers an action upon certain lifecycle hooks
in a User Task. Actions include:
- re-assign the User Task Run
- cancel the User Task Run
- execute a Reminder Task

Hooks include:
- Upon creation of the UserTaskRun
- Upon rescheduling the UserTaskRun

fields.name: reassign
fields.description: later on, might enable scheduling entire ThreadRuns

fields.name: delay_seconds
fields.description:
The Action is triggered some time after the Hook matures. The delay is controlled
by this field.

fields.name: hook
fields.description: The hook on which this UserTaskAction is scheduled.

messages.name: UTACancel
messages.description: A UserTaskAction that causes a UserTaskRun to be CANCELLED when it fires.

messages.name: UTAReassign
messages.description: A UserTaskAction that causes a UserTaskRun to be reassigned when it fires.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description:
A variable assignment that resolves to a STR representing the new user_id. If
not set, the user_id of the UserTaskRun will be un-set.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: user_group
fields.description:
A variable assignment that resolves to a STR representing the new user_group. If
not set, the user_group of the UserTaskRun will be un-set.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: UTATask
messages.description: A UserTaskAction that causes a TaskRun to be scheduled when it fires.

fields.name: task
fields.description: The specification of the Task to schedule.

fields.name: mutations
fields.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Any variables in the ThreadRun which we should mutate.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VariableAssignment
messages.description:
A VariableAssignment is used within a WfSpec to determine how a value should be
assigned in the context of a specific WfRun. For example, in a TASK node, you
use a VariableAssignment for each input parameter to determine how the value
is set.

Note that the VariableAssignment is normally handled by the SDK; you shouldn't
have to worry about this in daily LittleHorse usage.

fields.name: json_path
fields.description:
If you provide a `variable_name` and the specified variable is JSON_OBJ or
JSON_ARR type, then you may also provide a json_path which makes the VariableAssignment
resolve to the specified field.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: variable_name
fields.description: Assign the value from a variable.

fields.name: literal_value
fields.description: Assign a literal value

fields.name: format_string
fields.description: Assign a format string

messages.name: FormatString
messages.description: A FormatString formats a template String with values from the WfRun.

fields.name: format
fields.description:
A VariableAssignment which must resolve to a String that has format args.
A valid string is "This is a format string with three args: {0}, {1}, {2}"

fields.name: args
fields.description: VariableAssignments which fill out the args.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VariableDef
messages.description: Declares a Variable.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The Type of the variable.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the variable.

fields.name: default_value
fields.description:
Optional default value if the variable isn't set; for example, in a ThreadRun
if you start a ThreadRun or WfRun without passing a variable in, then this is
used.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: VariableMutation
messages.description:
A VariableMutation defines a modification made to one of a ThreadRun's variables.
The LHS determines the variable that is modified; the operation determines how
it is modified, and the RHS is the input to the operation.

Day-to-day users of LittleHorse generally don't interact with this structure unless
they are writing their own WfSpec SDK.

fields.name: lhs_name
fields.description: The name of the variable to mutate

fields.name: lhs_json_path
fields.description:
For JSON_ARR and JSON_OBJ variables, this allows you to optionally mutate
a specific sub-field of the variable.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: operation
fields.description: Defines the operation that we are executing.

fields.name: source_variable
fields.description:
Set the source_variable as the RHS to use another variable from the workflow to
as the RHS/

fields.name: literal_value
fields.description: Use a literal value as the RHS.

fields.name: node_output
fields.description: Use the output of the current node as the RHS.

messages.name: NodeOutputSource
messages.description: Specifies to use the output of a NodeRun as the RHS.

fields.name: jsonpath
fields.description: Use this specific field from a JSON output
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ExternalEvent
messages.description:
An ExternalEvent represents A Thing That Happened outside the context of a WfRun.
Generally, an ExternalEvent is used to represent a document getting signed, an incident
being resolved, an order being fulfilled, etc.

ExternalEvent's are created via the 'rpc PutExternalEvent'

For more context on ExternalEvents, check our documentation here:
https://littlehorse.dev/docs/concepts/external-events

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID of the ExternalEvent. This contains WfRunId, ExternalEventDefId,
and a unique guid which can be used for idempotency of the `PutExternalEvent`
rpc call.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time the ExternalEvent was registered with LittleHorse.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The payload of this ExternalEvent.

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description:
If the ExternalEvent was claimed by a specific ThreadRun (via Interrupt or
EXTERNAL_EVENT Node), this is set to the number of the relevant ThreadRun.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: node_run_position
fields.description:
If the ExternalEvent was claimed by a specific ThreadRun (via EXTERNAL_EVENT
Node; note that in the case of an Interrupt the node_run_position will never
be set), this is set to the number of the relevant NodeRun.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: claimed
fields.description: Whether the ExternalEvent has been claimed by a WfRun.

messages.name: ExternalEventDef
messages.description: The ExternalEventDef defines the blueprint for an ExternalEvent.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the ExternalEventDef.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: When the ExternalEventDef was created.

fields.name: retention_policy
fields.description:
The retention policy for ExternalEvent's of this ExternalEventDef. This applies to the
ExternalEvent **only before** it is matched with a WfRun.

messages.name: ExternalEventRetentionPolicy
messages.description:
Policy to determine how long an ExternalEvent is retained after creation if it
is not yet claimed by a WfRun. Note that once a WfRun has been matched with the
ExternalEvent, the ExternalEvent is deleted if/when that WfRun is deleted.
If not set, then ExternalEvent's are not deleted if they are not matched with
a WfRun.

A future version of LittleHorse will allow changing the retention_policy, which
will trigger a cleanup of old `ExternalEvent`s.

fields.name: seconds_after_put
fields.description:
Delete such an ExternalEvent X seconds after it has been registered if it
has not yet been claimed by a WfRun.

enums.name: WaitingThreadStatus
enums.description: The status of a single ThreadRun that we are waiting for.

values.name: THREAD_IN_PROGRESS
values.description: The ThreadRun is in progress (i.e. not COMPLETED nor EXCEPTION nor ERROR)

values.name: THREAD_HANDLING_FAILURE
values.description:
The ThreadRun failed with some failure, and the FailureHandler is running
for that Failure.

values.name: THREAD_COMPLETED_OR_FAILURE_HANDLED
values.description:
We can mark this ThreadRun as "already waited for", meaning that either:
1. It completed successfully, OR
2. It failed, and the Failure Handler successfully completed

values.name: THREAD_UNSUCCESSFUL
values.description:
The ThreadRun did not complete successfully, and there wasn't a successful
run of a Failure Handler for the Failure that was thrown.

messages.name: EntrypointRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for an ENTRYPOINT NodeRun. Currently Empty.

messages.name: ExitRun
messages.description:
The sub-node structure for an EXIT NodeRun. Currently Empty, will contain info
about ThreadRun Outputs once those are added in the future.

messages.name: ExternalEventRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for an EXTERNAL_EVENT NodeRun.

fields.name: external_event_def_id
fields.description: The ExternalEventDefId that we are waiting for.

fields.name: event_time
fields.description: The time that the ExternalEvent arrived. Unset if still waiting.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: external_event_id
fields.description: The ExternalEventId of the ExternalEvent. Unset if still waiting.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: timed_out
fields.description: Whether we had a timeout while waiting for the ExternalEvent to come.

messages.name: Failure
messages.description:
Denotes a failure that happened during execution of a NodeRun or the outgoing
edges.

fields.name: failure_name
fields.description:
The name of the failure. LittleHorse has certain built-in failures, all named in
UPPER_UNDERSCORE_CASE. Such failures correspond with the `LHStatus.ERROR`.

Any Failure named in `kebab-case` is a user-defined business `EXCEPTION`, treated
as an `LHStatus.EXCEPTION`.

fields.name: message
fields.description: The human-readable message associated with this Failure.

fields.name: content
fields.description:
A user-defined Failure can have a value; for example, in Java an Exception is an
Object with arbitrary properties and behaviors.

Future versions of LH will allow FailureHandler threads to accept that value as
an input variable.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: was_properly_handled
fields.description: A boolean denoting whether a Failure Handler ThreadRun properly handled the Failure.

fields.name: failure_handler_threadrun_id
fields.description:
If there is a defined failure handler for the NodeRun, then this field is set to the
id of the failure handler thread run.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: NodeRun
messages.description:
A NodeRun is a running instance of a Node in a ThreadRun. Note that a NodeRun
is a Getable object, meaning it can be retried from the LittleHorse grpc API.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID of the NodeRun. Note that the NodeRunId contains the WfRunId, the
ThreadRun's number, and the position of the NodeRun within that ThreadRun.

fields.name: wf_spec_id
fields.description:
The ID of the WfSpec that this NodeRun is from. This is not _always_ the same
as the ThreadRun it belongs to because of the upcoming WfSpec Version Migration
feature.

fields.name: failure_handler_ids
fields.description: A list of all ThreadRun's that ran to handle a failure thrown by this NodeRun.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this NodeRun.

fields.name: arrival_time
fields.description: The time the ThreadRun arrived at this NodeRun.

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: The time the NodeRun was terminated (failed or completed).
fields.label: optional

fields.name: thread_spec_name
fields.description: The name of the ThreadSpec to which this NodeRun belongs.

fields.name: node_name
fields.description: The name of the Node in the ThreadSpec that this NodeRun belongs to.

fields.name: error_message
fields.description:
A human-readable error message intended to help developers diagnose WfSpec
problems.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: failures
fields.description: A list of Failures thrown by this NodeRun.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: task
fields.description: Denotes a TASK node, which runs a TaskRun.

fields.name: external_event
fields.description: An EXTERNAL_EVENT node blocks until an ExternalEvent arrives.

fields.name: entrypoint
fields.description: An ENTRYPOINT node is the first thing that runs in a ThreadRun.

fields.name: exit
fields.description: An EXIT node completes a ThreadRun.

fields.name: start_thread
fields.description: A START_THREAD node starts a child ThreadRun.

fields.name: wait_threads
fields.description: A WAIT_THREADS node waits for one or more child ThreadRun's to complete.

fields.name: sleep
fields.description: A SLEEP node makes the ThreadRun block for a certain amount of time.

fields.name: user_task
fields.description: A USER_TASK node waits until a human executes some work and reports the result.

fields.name: start_multiple_threads
fields.description:
A START_MULTIPLE_THREADS node iterates over a JSON_ARR variable and spawns a
child ThreadRun for each element in the list.

messages.name: SleepNodeRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for a SLEEP NodeRun.

fields.name: maturation_time
fields.description:
The time at which the NodeRun is *SCHEDULED TO* wake up. In rare cases, if
the LH Server is back-pressuring clients due to extreme load, the timer
event which marks the sleep node as "matured" may come in slightly late.

fields.name: matured
fields.description: Whether the SleepNodeRun has been matured.

messages.name: StartMultipleThreadsRun
messages.description:
The sub-node structure for a START_MULTIPLE_THREADS NodeRun.

Note: the output of this NodeRun, which can be used to mutate Variables,
is a JSON_ARR variable containing the ID's of all the child threadRuns.

fields.name: thread_spec_name
fields.description: The thread_spec_name of the child thread_runs.

fields.name: child_thread_ids
fields.description: The list of all created child ThreadRun's
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: StartThreadRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for a START_THREAD NodeRun.

fields.name: child_thread_id
fields.description:
Contains the thread_run_number of the created Child ThreadRun, if it has
been created already.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: thread_spec_name
fields.description: The thread_spec_name of the child thread_run.

messages.name: TaskNodeRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for a TASK NodeRun.

fields.name: task_run_id
fields.description:
The ID of the TaskRun. Note that if the ThreadRun was halted when it arrived
at this TASK Node, then the task_run_id will be unset.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: UserTaskNodeRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for a USER_TASK NodeRun.

fields.name: user_task_run_id
fields.description:
The ID of the UserTaskRun. Note that if the ThreadRun was halted when it arrived
at this USER_TASK node, then the user_task_run_id will be unset.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: WaitForThreadsRun
messages.description: The sub-node structure for a WAIT_FOR_THREADS NodeRun.

fields.name: threads
fields.description: The threads that are being waited for.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: WaitForThread
messages.description: A 'WaitForThread' structure defines a thread that is being waited for.

fields.name: thread_end_time
fields.description:
The time at which the ThreadRun ended (successfully or not). Not set if the ThreadRun
is still RUNNING, HALTED, or HALTING.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: thread_status
fields.description: The current status of the ThreadRun being waited for.

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description: The number of the ThreadRun being waited for.

fields.name: waiting_status
fields.description:
The "waiting status" of this specific thread: whether it's still running,
already done, handling a failure, or completely failed.

fields.name: failure_handler_thread_run_id
fields.description:
If there is a failure on the ThreadRun, and we have a failure handler defined
for it, then we will start a failure handler for this threadrun. This field
is the id of that threadRun.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ExternalEventDefId
messages.description: ID for ExternalEventDef

fields.name: name
fields.description: ExternalEventDef's are uniquedly identified by their name.

messages.name: ExternalEventId
messages.description: ID for an ExternalEvent.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description:
WfRunId for the ExternalEvent. Note that every ExternalEvent is associated
with a WfRun.

fields.name: external_event_def_id
fields.description: The ExternalEventDef for this ExternalEvent.

fields.name: guid
fields.description:
A unique guid allowing for distinguishing this ExternalEvent from other events
of the same ExternalEventDef and WfRun.

messages.name: NodeRunId
messages.description: ID for a NodeRun.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description:
ID of the WfRun for this NodeRun. Note that every NodeRun is associated with
a WfRun.

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description: ThreadRun of this NodeRun. Note that each NodeRun belongs to a ThreadRun.

fields.name: position
fields.description: Position of this NodeRun within its ThreadRun.

messages.name: PrincipalId
messages.description: ID for a Principal.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The id of this principal. In OAuth, this is the OAuth Client ID (for
machine principals) or the OAuth User Id (for human principals).

messages.name: TaskDefId
messages.description: ID for a TaskDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: TaskDef's are uniquely identified by their name.

messages.name: TaskDefMetricsId
messages.description: ID for a specific window of TaskDef metrics.

fields.name: window_start
fields.description: The timestamp at which this metrics window starts.

fields.name: window_type
fields.description: The length of this window.

fields.name: task_def_id
fields.description: The TaskDefId that this metrics window reports on.

messages.name: TaskRunId
messages.description: ID for a TaskRun.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description:
WfRunId for this TaskRun. Note that every TaskRun is associated with
a WfRun.

fields.name: task_guid
fields.description: Unique identifier for this TaskRun. Unique among the WfRun.

messages.name: TaskWorkerGroupId
messages.description: ID for a TaskWorkerGroup.

fields.name: task_def_id
fields.description: TaskWorkerGroups are uniquely identified by their TaskDefId.

messages.name: TenantId
messages.description: ID for a Tenant.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The Tenant ID.

messages.name: UserTaskDefId
messages.description: ID for a UserTaskDef

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of a UserTaskDef

fields.name: version
fields.description: Note that UserTaskDef's use simple versioning.

messages.name: UserTaskRunId
messages.description: ID for a UserTaskRun

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description:
WfRunId for this UserTaskRun. Note that every UserTaskRun is associated
with a WfRun.

fields.name: user_task_guid
fields.description: Unique identifier for this UserTaskRun.

messages.name: VariableId
messages.description: Id for a Variable.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description:
WfRunId for the variable. Note that every Variable is associated with
a WfRun.

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description:
Each Variable is owned by a specific ThreadRun inside the WfRun it belongs
to. This is that ThreadRun's number.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the variable.

messages.name: WfRunId
messages.description: ID for a WfRun

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID for this WfRun instance.

fields.name: parent_wf_run_id

messages.name: WfSpecId

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the WfSpec.

fields.name: major_version
fields.description:
Major Version of a WfSpec.

Note that WfSpec's are versioned. Creating a new WfSpec with the same name
and no breaking changes to the public Variables API results in a new WfSpec
being created with the same MajorVersion and a new revision. Creating a
WfSpec with a breaking change to the public Variables API results in a
new WfSpec being created with the same name, an incremented major_version,
and revision = 0.

fields.name: revision
fields.description:
Revision of a WfSpec.

Note that WfSpec's are versioned. Creating a new WfSpec with the same name
and no breaking changes to the public Variables API results in a new WfSpec
being created with the same MajorVersion and a new revision. Creating a
WfSpec with a breaking change to the public Variables API results in a
new WfSpec being created with the same name, an incremented major_version,
and revision = 0.

fields.description:
A sequence number that makes the WorkflowEventId unique among all WorkflowEvent's of the
same type thrown by the WfRun. This field starts at zero and is incremented every
time a WorkflowEvent of the same type is thrown by the same WfRun.

enums.name: AllowedUpdateType
enums.description:
This enum controls the behavior of a PutWfSpecRequest when a WfSpec with the same
name previously exists.

values.name: ALL_UPDATES
values.description:
Allows any update: both minor (revsion) changes and breaking (majorVersion) changes
are accepted

values.name: MINOR_REVISION_UPDATES
values.description:
Allows only backwards-compatible changes that do not change the required input variables
or the searchable variables in the WfSpec.

values.name: NO_UPDATES
values.description: Rejects any changes to the WfSpec.

enums.name: NodeType
enums.description: This enum denotes the type of a NodeRun.

values.name: TASK
values.description: TASK node schedules a TaskRun

values.name: EXTERNAL_EVENT
values.description: EXTERNAL_EVENT blocks the ThreadRun until a specified ExternalEvent arrives

values.name: ENTRYPOINT
values.description: ENTRYPOINT kicks off a ThreadRun

values.name: EXIT
values.description: EXIT completes a ThreadRun

values.name: START_THREAD
values.description: START_THREAD creates a Child ThreadRun

values.name: WAIT_THREADS
values.description: WAIT_THREADS waits for one or more child ThreadRuns to complete

values.name: SLEEP
values.description: SLEEP makes the ThreadRun sleep for a specified time

values.name: USER_TASK
values.description: USER_TASK creates a UserTaskRun and blocks until the UserTaskRun is completed.

values.name: START_MULTIPLE_THREADS
values.description: START_MULTIPLE_THREADS iterates over a list and starts a Child Thread for each item

messages.name: AwaitWorkflowEventRequest
messages.description:
Request to await until a WorkflowEvent of a certain WorkflowEventDef on a certain WfRun
is thrown. Relies upon native GRPC deadlines to configure timeouts.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description: The ID of the WfRun which must throw the WorkflowEvent.

fields.description:
The IDs of the WorkflowEventDef that must be thrown. The request will return the first matching
WorkflowEvent is thrown. If event_def_ids is empty, then the request will return the first
WorkflowEvent thrown by the WfRun.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: workflow_events_to_ignore
fields.description:
Since a single WfRun may throw multiple WorkflowEvent's with the same WorkflowEventDefId, it
is necessary to provide a client the ability to "ignore" WorkflowEvent's that have already been
'awaited'. Any WorkflowEvent specified by this field is ignored by the rpc.

messages.description: Field to create an ExternalEventDef.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the resulting ExternalEventDef.

fields.name: retention_policy
fields.description:
Policy to determine how long an ExternalEvent is retained after creation if it
is not yet claimed by a WfRun. Note that once a WfRun has been matched with the
ExternalEvent, the ExternalEvent is deleted if/when that WfRun is deleted.
If not set, then ExternalEvent's are not deleted if they are not matched with
a WfRun.

A future version of LittleHorse will allow changing the retention_policy, which
will trigger a cleanup of old `ExternalEvent`s.

messages.description: Request used to create an ExternalEvent.

fields.name: wf_run_id

fields.description: The ID of the ExternalEventDef that this event implements.

fields.name: guid
fields.description:
Note that an ExternalEventDefId is a three-part ID:
1. WfRunId
2. ExternalEventDef Name
3. A guid
The guid from part 3) can be optionally provided to the PutExternalEventRequest
in order to make it idempotent. It is a best practice to do so.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description: Optionally specify that this ExternalEvent may only be claimed by a specific ThreadRun.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: node_run_position
fields.description:
Optionally specify that this ExternalEvent may only be claimed by a specific NodeRun.
In order for this to be set, you must also set thread_run_number.
fields.label: optional

The number of the ThreadRun to resume. Note that resuming the entrypoint ThreadRun (which

messages.name: RunWfRequest
messages.description: Create a Workflow Run.

fields.name: wf_spec_name
fields.description: The name of the WfSpec to run.

fields.name: major_version
fields.description:
Optionally specify the major version of the WfSpec to run. This guarantees that
the "signature" of the WfSpec (i.e. the required input variables, and searchable
variables) will not change for this app.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: revision
fields.description:
Optionally specify the specific revision of the WfSpec to run. It is not recommended
to use this in practice, as the WfSpec logic should be de-coupled from the applications
that run WfRun's.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: variables

A map from Variable Name to Values for those variables. The provided variables are
passed as input to the Entrypoint ThreadRun.

fields.description:
You can optionally specify the ID of this WfRun. This is a recommended best practice
as it also makes your request idempotent and allows you to easily find the WfRun at
a later time.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: task_def_id
fields.description: ID of the TaskDef to which the TaskRun belongs.

fields.description:
Attempt number of the TaskRun, zero indexed. attempt_number of `0` means this is the
first attempt; `1` means this is the first retry, etc.

fields.label: repeated

fields.name: source
fields.description:
Source of the TaskRun. Currently, there are two options:
1. A TASK node
2. A reminder task scheduled by a trigger on a User Task.

messages.name: SearchExternalEventRequest
messages.description:
EVOLVING: Search for ExternalEvent's.

Currently, this request allows you to search for ExternalEvent's based on either:
1. A WfRunId
2. An ExternalEventDefName and status.

This specific RPC is under discussions for a Refactor and will soon experience breaking changes.
It is recommended for applications needing to search by WfRunId to instead use the
`rpc ListExternalEvents` call, as we plan to remove the 'by WfRunId' option from this request.

Specifically, we plan to remove the "by wfRunId" option (which is redundant with the ListExternalEvents
request), and "flatten" the "ByExtEvtDefNameAndStatusRequest" fields into the main message.

messages.name: SearchVariableRequest
messages.description:
Search for Variables by their value. This request is also highly useful to search for
WfRun's based on the value of Variable's that are not in the Entrypoint ThreadRun,
and also when you are using LittleHorse as a data store and need to perform a search.

You may only search for a Variable that has an index specified on it. This may be done
via th `.searchable()` method on our SDK's.

Note that we do not yet support searching JSON_OBJ or JSON_ARR fields, but you may
still mark those fields as searchable. We will soon add the ability to query those
fields via the indices.

messages.name: StopWfRunRequest
messages.description: Message to HALT a WfRun.

fields.name: wf_run_id
fields.description: Is the WfRunId

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description:
The number of the ThreadRun to halt. Note that halting the entrypoint ThreadRun (which
always has number `0`) causes the whole WfRun to halt. If you do not manually set
the thread_run_number field, it defaults to zero, so stopping the entire WfRun is the
default behavior.

methods.name: PutTaskDef
methods.description: Creates a TaskDef.

methods.name: GetTaskDef
methods.description: Gets a TaskDef.

methods.name: PutExternalEventDef
methods.description: Creates an ExternalEventDef.

methods.name: GetExternalEventDef
methods.description: Gets an ExternalEventDef.

methods.name: PutWorkflowEventDef
methods.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Creates a WorkflowEventDef.

methods.name: PutWfSpec
methods.description: Creates a WfSpec.

methods.name: GetWfSpec
methods.description: Gets a WfSpec.

methods.name: GetLatestWfSpec
methods.description: Returns the latest WfSpec with a specified name (and optionally a specified Major Version).

methods.name: MigrateWfSpec
methods.description:
EXPERIMENTAL: Migrates all WfRun's from one version of a WfSpec onto a newer version of the
same WfSpec. This is useful for long-running WfRun's (eg. a 60-day marketing campaign) where
you must update WfRun's that are in the RUNNING state rather than allowing them to run to
completion.

As of 0.7.2, this feature is only partially implemented.

methods.name: PutUserTaskDef
methods.description: Creates a UserTaskDef.

methods.name: GetUserTaskDef
methods.description:
Gets a specific UserTaskDef.

This RPC is highly useful for applications built around
User Tasks. For example, a UI that dynamically displays form fields based on the User Task
might first receive a UserTaskRun, then use that UserTaskRun to look up the UserTaskDef.
The frontend would inspect the UserTaskDef and display a form field on the browser page
for each field in the UserTaskDef.

methods.name: GetLatestUserTaskDef
methods.description: Returns the most recent UserTaskDef with a specific name.

methods.name: RunWf
methods.description: Runs a WfSpec to create a WfRun.

methods.name: GetWfRun
methods.description:
Gets a WfRun. Although useful for development and debugging, this RPC is not often
used by applications.

methods.name: GetUserTaskRun
methods.description:
Loads a specific UserTaskRun. It includes information about to whom the UserTask is
currently assigned, history of assignments and reassignments, and any context for that
UserTaskRun which is specific to the WfRun.

methods.name: AssignUserTaskRun
methods.description:
Change the ownership of a UserTaskRun to a new userId, userGroup, or both. The
action will be reflected in your next call to SearchUserTaskRun. This RPC is useful for
applications that are using User Tasks to build an internal task-list and wish to
administer the tasks.

methods.name: CompleteUserTaskRun
methods.description:
Completes a UserTaskRun. Includes the results of the UserTaskRun, the UserTaskRun Id, and
the userId of the user who completes the UserTaskRun. Results in the UserTask NodeRun being
completed, and unblocks the associated ThreadRun in the WfRun.

This RPC is highly useful for applications built around a WfSpec that uses USER_TASK nodes.

methods.name: CancelUserTaskRun
methods.description: Cancels a UserTaskRun. This will result in an EXCEPTION being propagated to the WfRun.

methods.name: ListUserTaskRuns
methods.description:
Lists all UserTaskRun's for a specific WfRun. Can be useful when using a WfRun
to model an entity.

methods.name: GetNodeRun
methods.description: Gets a specific NodeRun.

methods.name: ListNodeRuns
methods.description: Lists all NodeRun's for a specific WfRun.

methods.name: GetTaskRun
methods.description: Gets a specific TaskRun.

methods.name: ListTaskRuns
methods.description: Lists all TaskRun's for a specific WfRun.

methods.name: GetVariable
methods.description:
Get the value of a specific Variable. When using a WfRun to model an entity, this
RPC is useful for retrieving information. It is equivalent to looking up the value of a
column for a specific row in a SQL table.

methods.name: ListVariables
methods.description: List all Variables from a WfRun.

methods.name: PutExternalEvent
methods.description: Post an ExternalEvent. This RPC is highly useful for

methods.name: GetExternalEvent
methods.description: Get a specific ExternalEvent.

methods.name: AwaitWorkflowEvent
methods.description:
Waits for a WorkflowEvent to be thrown by a given WfRun. Returns immediately if a matching
WorkflowEvent has already been thrown; throws a DEADLINE_EXCEEDED error if the WorkflowEvent
is not thrown before the deadline specified by the client.

To specify the deadline, the client should use GRPC deadlines.

methods.name: ListExternalEvents
methods.description: List ExternalEvent's for a specific WfRun.

methods.name: SearchWfRun
methods.description:
Search for WfRun's. This RPC is highly useful for applications that store data
in LittleHorse and need to find a specific WfRun based on certain indexed fields.

methods.name: SearchNodeRun
methods.description:
Search for NodeRun's. This RPC is useful for monitoring and finding bugs in
your workflows or Task Workers.

methods.name: SearchTaskRun
methods.description: Search for TaskRun's. This RPC is useful for finding bugs in your Task Workers.

methods.name: SearchUserTaskRun
methods.description:
Search for UserTaskRun's. This RPC is highly useful for applications that connect
human end-users to LittleHorse: it enables you to find all tasks assigned to a specific
person or group of people.

methods.name: SearchVariable
methods.description:
Search for Variable's. This RPC is highly useful for applications that store data
in LittleHorse and need to find a specific WfRun based on certain indexed fields.

methods.name: SearchExternalEvent
methods.description: Search for ExternalEvent's.

methods.name: SearchTaskDef
methods.description: Search for TaskDef's.

methods.name: SearchUserTaskDef
methods.description: Search for UserTaskDef's.

methods.name: SearchWfSpec
methods.description: Search for WfSpec's.

methods.name: SearchExternalEventDef
methods.description: Search for ExternalEventDef's.

methods.name: SearchTenant
methods.description: Search for all available TenantIds for current Principal

methods.name: RegisterTaskWorker
methods.description:
Used by the Task Worker to:
1. Tell the LH Server that the Task Worker has joined the Task Worker Group.
2. Receive the assignemnt of LH Server's to poll from.
Generally, you won't use this request manually.

methods.name: PollTask
methods.description:
Used by Task Workers to listen for TaskRuns on the Task Queue. Generally, you won't
use this RPC manually.

methods.name: ReportTask
methods.description:
Used by Task Workers to report the result of a TaskRun. Generally, you won't use
this rpc manually.

methods.name: StopWfRun
methods.description: Move a WfRun or a specific ThreadRun in that WfRun to the HALTED state.

methods.name: ResumeWfRun
methods.description: Resumes a WfRun or a specific ThreadRun of a WfRun.

methods.name: DeleteWfRun
methods.description: Deletes a WfRun. The WfRun cannot be in the RUNNING state.

methods.name: DeleteTaskDef
methods.description: Deletes a TaskDef.

methods.name: DeleteWfSpec
methods.description: Deletes a WfSpec.

methods.name: DeleteUserTaskDef
methods.description: Deletes a UserTaskDef.

methods.name: DeleteExternalEventDef
methods.description: Deletes an ExternalEventDef.

methods.name: GetTaskDefMetricsWindow
methods.description: Returns TaskDef Metrics for a specific TaskDef and a specific time window.

methods.name: GetWfSpecMetricsWindow
methods.description: Returns WfSpec Metrics for a specific WfSpec and a specific time window.

methods.name: ListTaskDefMetrics
methods.description: Returns a list of TaskDef Metrics Windows.

methods.name: ListWfSpecMetrics
methods.description: Returns a list of WfSpec Metrics Windows.

methods.name: PutTenant
methods.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Creates another Tenant in the LH Server.

methods.name: PutPrincipal
methods.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Creates an Principal.

methods.name: Whoami
methods.description: Returns the Principal of the caller.

methods.name: GetServerVersion
methods.description: Gets the version of the LH Server.

messages.name: TaskDef
messages.description: A TaskDef defines a blueprint for a TaskRun that can be dispatched to Task Workers.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of this TaskDef.

fields.name: input_vars
fields.description: The input variables required to execute this TaskDef.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time at which this TaskDef was created.

messages.name: LHTaskError
messages.description: Message denoting a TaskRun failed for technical reasons.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The technical error code.

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable message for debugging.

messages.name: LHTaskException
messages.description:
Message denoting a TaskRun's execution signaled that something went wrong in the
business process, throwing a littlehorse 'EXCEPTION'.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The user-defined Failure name, for example, "credit-card-declined"

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readadble description of the failure.

messages.name: TaskAttempt
messages.description: A single time that a TaskRun was scheduled for execution on a Task Queue.

fields.name: log_output
fields.description:
Optional information provided by the Task Worker SDK for debugging. Usually, if set
it contains a stacktrace or it contains information logged via `WorkerContext#log()`.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: schedule_time
fields.description:
The time the TaskAttempt was scheduled on the Task Queue. Not set for a TaskAttempt that is
in the TASK_PENDING status; for example, when waiting between retries with exponential
backoff.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: The time the TaskAttempt was pulled off the queue and sent to a TaskWorker.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: end_time
fields.description:
The time the TaskAttempt was finished (either completed, reported as failed, or
timed out)
fields.label: optional

fields.name: task_worker_id
fields.description: EXPERIMENTAL: the ID of the Task Worker who executed this TaskRun.

fields.name: task_worker_version
fields.description: The version of the Task Worker that executed the TaskAttempt.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this TaskAttempt.

fields.name: output
fields.description: Denotes the Task Function executed properly and returned an output.

fields.name: error
fields.description: An unexpected technical error was encountered. May or may not be retriable.

fields.name: exception
fields.description: The Task Function encountered a business problem and threw a technical exception.

messages.name: TaskNodeReference
messages.description: Reference to a NodeRun of type TASK which caused a TaskRun to be scheduled.

fields.name: node_run_id
fields.description: The ID of the NodeRun which caused this TASK to be scheduled.

messages.name: TaskRun
messages.description: A TaskRun resents a single instance of a TaskDef being executed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the TaskRun. Note that the TaskRunId contains the WfRunId.

fields.name: task_def_id
fields.description: The ID of the TaskDef being executed.

fields.name: attempts
fields.description:
All attempts scheduled for this TaskRun. A TaskAttempt represents an occurrence of
the TaskRun being put on a Task Queue to be executed by the Task Workers.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: input_variables
fields.description:
The input variables to pass into this TaskRun. Note that this is a list and not
a map, because ordering matters. Depending on the language implementation, not
every LittleHorse Task Worker SDK has the ability to determine the names of the
variables from the method signature, so we provide both names and ordering.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: source
fields.description:
The source (in the WfRun) that caused this TaskRun to be created. Currently, this
can be either a TASK node, or a User Task Action Task Trigger in a USER_TASK node (such
as a task used to send reminders).

fields.name: scheduled_at
fields.description: When the TaskRun was scheduled.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the TaskRun.

fields.name: timeout_seconds
fields.description: The timeout before LH considers a TaskAttempt to be timed out.

fields.name: total_attempts
fields.description:
The maximum number of attempts that may be scheduled for this TaskRun. NOTE: setting
total_attempts to 1 means that there are no retries.

fields.name: exponential_backoff
fields.description: Optional backoff policy .
fields.label: optional

messages.name: TaskRunSource
messages.description: The source of a TaskRun; i.e. why it was scheduled.

fields.name: task_node
fields.description: Reference to a NodeRun of type TASK which scheduled this TaskRun.

fields.name: user_task_trigger
fields.description: Reference to the specific UserTaskRun trigger action which scheduled this TaskRun

fields.name: wf_spec_id
fields.description:
The ID of the WfSpec that is being executed. Always set in ScheduledTask.source so
that the WorkerContext can know this information.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: VarNameAndVal
messages.description: A key-value pair of variable name and value.

fields.name: var_name
fields.description: The variable name.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the variable for this TaskRun.

enums.name: UserTaskRunStatus
enums.description: The status that a UserTaskRun can be in.

values.name: UNASSIGNED
values.description: Not assigned to a specific user yet.

values.name: ASSIGNED
values.description: Assigned to a specific user, but not completed or cancelled yet.

values.name: DONE
values.description: Done.

values.name: CANCELLED
values.description: Cancelled.

messages.name: AssignUserTaskRunRequest
messages.description: Re-Assigns a UserTaskRun to a specific userId or userGroup.

fields.name: user_task_run_id
fields.description: The UserTaskRun to assign to a new user_id or user_group.

fields.name: override_claim
fields.description:
If override_claim is set to false and the UserTaskRun is already assigned to
a user_id, then the request throws a FAILED_PRECONDITION error. If set to
true, then the old claim is overriden and the UserTaskRun is assigned to
the new user.

fields.name: user_group
fields.description:
The new user_group to which the UserTaskRun is assigned. If not set, then
the user_group of the UserTaskRun is actively unset by this request. At least
one of the user_group and user_id must be set.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: user_id
fields.description:
The new user_id to which the UserTaskRun is assigned. If not set, then
the user_id of the UserTaskRun is actively unset by this request. At least
one of the user_group and user_id must be set.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CancelUserTaskRunRequest
messages.description: Cancels a UserTaskRun.

fields.name: user_task_run_id
fields.description: The id of the UserTaskRun to cancel.

messages.name: CompleteUserTaskRunRequest
messages.description: Completes a UserTaskRun with provided values.

fields.name: user_task_run_id
fields.description: The id of UserTaskRun to complete.

fields.name: results
fields.description:
A map from UserTaskField.name to a VariableValue containing the results of the
user filling out the form.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: user_id
fields.description: The ID of the user who executed the task.

messages.name: UserTaskDef
messages.description: UserTaskDef is the metadata blueprint for UserTaskRuns.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the `UserTaskDef`

fields.name: version
fields.description: The version of the `UserTaskDef`. Only simple versioning is supported.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Metadata field that does not impact WfRun execution. Useful for providing
context on the UserTaskRun, for example when displaying it on a general-purpose
task manager application.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: fields
fields.description:
These are the fields comprise the User Task. A User Task Manager application, or
any application used to complete a UserTaskRun, should inspect these fields and
display form entries for each one.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time the UserTaskRun was created.

messages.name: UserTaskEvent
messages.description:
This is an event stored in the audit log of a `UserTaskRun` purely for observability
purposes.

fields.name: time
fields.description: the time the event occurred.

fields.name: task_executed
fields.description: Denotes that a TaskRun was scheduled via a trigger.

fields.name: assigned
fields.description: Denotes that the UserTaskRun was assigned.

fields.name: cancelled
fields.description:
Denotes that the UserTaskRun was cancelled.

TODO: Add "save user task" and "complete user task" to the
audit log

messages.name: UTEAssigned
messages.description: Message denoting that the UserTaskRun was assigned.

fields.name: old_user_id
fields.description: The user_id before the ownership change, if set.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: old_user_group
fields.description: The user_group before the ownership change, if set.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: new_user_id
fields.description: The user_id after the ownership change, if set.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: new_user_group
fields.description: The user_group after the ownership change, if set.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: UTECancelled
messages.description: Empty message used to denote that the `UserTaskRun` was cancelled.

messages.name: UTETaskExecuted
messages.description: Message to denote that a `TaskRun` was scheduled by a trigger for this UserTaskRun.

fields.name: task_run
fields.description: The `TaskRunId` of the scheduled `TaskRun`

messages.name: UserTaskField
messages.description: A UserTaskField is a specific field of data to be entered into a UserTaskRun.

fields.name: name
fields.description:
The name of the field. When a UserTaskRun is completed, the NodeOutput is a
single-level JSON_OBJ. Each key is the name of the field. Must be unique.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the output. Must be a primitive type (STR, BOOL, INT, DOUBLE).

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Optional description which can be displayed by the User Task UI application.
Does not affect WfRun execution.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: display_name
fields.description:
The name to be displayed by the User Task UI application. Does not affect
WfRun execution.

fields.name: required
fields.description: Whether this field is required for UserTaskRun completion.

messages.name: UserTaskRun
messages.description:
A UserTaskRun is a running instance of a UserTaskDef. It is created when a
ThreadRun arrives at a Node of type `USER_TASK`.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the UserTaskRun.

fields.name: user_task_def_id
fields.description: The ID of the UserTaskDef that this UserTaskRun comes from.

fields.name: user_group
fields.description:
The user_group to which this UserTaskRun is assigned. Not Set if not assigned
to a group. At least one of user_group or user_id will be set for any given
UserTaskRun.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: user_id
fields.description:
The user_id to which this UserTaskRun is assigned. Not Set if not assigned
to a user. At least one of user_group or user_id will be set for any given
UserTaskRun. If user_id is set, then the UserTaskRun cannot be in the
UNASSIGNED status.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: results
fields.description:
The results of the UserTaskRun. Empty if the UserTaskRun has not yet been completed.
Each key in this map is the `name` of a corresponding `UserTaskField` on the
UserTaskDef.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the UserTaskRun. Can be UNASSIGNED, ASSIGNED, DONE, or CANCELLED.

fields.name: events
fields.description: A list of events that have happened. Used for auditing information.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: notes
fields.description:
Notes about this UserTaskRun that are **specific to the WfRun**. These notes
are set by the WfSpec based on variables inside the specific `WfRun` and are
intended to be displayed on the User Task Manager application. They do not
affect WfRun execution.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: scheduled_time
fields.description: The time that the UserTaskRun was created/scheduled.

fields.name: node_run_id
fields.description: The NodeRun with which the UserTaskRun is associated.

fields.name: epoch
fields.description:
Current observed epoch of the UserTaskRun, related to the number of times it has been
updated or re-assigned. Used internally to implement automated reassignment and reminder
tasks.

messages.name: UserTaskTriggerReference
messages.description:
All TaskRun's have a "trigger reference" which refers to the WfRun Element that
caused the TaskRun to be scheduled. For example, a TaskRun on a regular TASK_NODE
has a TaskNodeReference.

The UserTaskTriggerReference serves as the "Trigger Reference" for a TaskRun that
was scheduled by a lifecycle hook on a UserTaskRun (eg. a reminder task).

The UserTaskTriggerReference is most useful in the WorkerContext of the Task Worker
SDK, which allows the Task Method to determine where the TaskRun comes from.

fields.name: node_run_id
fields.description: Is the NodeRun that the UserTaskRun belongs to.

fields.name: user_task_event_number
fields.description:
Is the index in the `events` field of the UserTaskRun that the TaskRun corresponds
to.

fields.name: user_id
fields.description:
Is the user_id that the UserTaskRun is assigned to. Unset if UserTaskRun is not
asigned to a specific user_id.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: user_group
fields.description:
Is the user_id that the UserTaskRun is assigned to. Unset if UserTaskRun is not
asigned to a specific user_id.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Variable
messages.description: A Variable is an instance of a variable assigned to a WfRun.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
ID of this Variable. Note that the VariableId contains the relevant
WfRunId inside it, the threadRunNumber, and the name of the Variabe.

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of this Variable.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: When the Variable was created.

fields.name: wf_spec_id
fields.description: The ID of the WfSpec that this Variable belongs to.

messages.name: VariableValue
messages.description:
VariableValue is a structure containing a value in LittleHorse. It can be
used to pass input variables into a WfRun/ThreadRun/TaskRun/etc, as output
from a TaskRun, as the value of a WfRun's Variable, etc.

fields.name: json_obj
fields.description: A String representing a serialized json object.

fields.name: json_arr
fields.description: A String representing a serialized json list.

fields.name: double
fields.description: A 64-bit floating point number.

fields.name: bool
fields.description: A boolean.

fields.name: str
fields.description: A string.

fields.name: int
fields.description: A 64-bit integer.

fields.name: bytes
fields.description: An arbitrary String of bytes.

values.name: ENTRYPOINT
values.description: The ENTRYPOINT ThreadRun. Exactly one per WfRun. Always has number == 0.

values.name: CHILD
values.description:
A ThreadRun explicitly created by another ThreadRun via a START_THREAD or START_MULTIPLE_THREADS
NodeRun.

values.name: INTERRUPT
values.description: A ThreadRun that was created to handle an Interrupt.

values.name: FAILURE_HANDLER
values.description: A ThreadRun that was created to handle a Failure.

messages.name: FailureBeingHandled
messages.description: Points to the Failure that is currently being handled in the ThreadRun.

fields.name: thread_run_number
fields.description: The thread run number.

fields.name: node_run_position
fields.description: The position of the NodeRun causing the failure.

fields.name: failure_number
fields.description: The number of the failure.

messages.name: HandlingFailureHaltReason
messages.description: A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun is halted while a Failure Handler is being run.

fields.name: handler_thread_id
fields.description: The ID of the Failure Handler ThreadRun.

messages.name: Interrupted
messages.description:
A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun is halted because it is waiting for the
interrupt handler threadRun to run.

fields.name: interrupt_thread_id
fields.description: The ID of the Interrupt Handler ThreadRun.

messages.name: ManualHalt
messages.description: A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun was halted manually, via the `rpc StopWfRun` request.

fields.name: meaning_of_life
fields.description: Nothing to store.

messages.name: ParentHalted
messages.description: A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun is halted because its parent is also HALTED.

fields.name: parent_thread_id
fields.description: The ID of the halted parent.

messages.name: PendingFailureHandler
messages.description: Represents a Failure Handler that is pending to be run.

fields.name: failed_thread_run
fields.description: The ThreadRun that failed.

fields.name: handler_spec_name
fields.description: The name of the ThreadSpec to run to handle the failure.

messages.name: PendingFailureHandlerHaltReason
messages.description:
A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun is halted while a Failure Handler is *enqueued* to be
run.

fields.name: node_run_position
fields.description: The position of the NodeRun which threw the failure.

messages.name: PendingInterrupt
messages.description:
Represents an ExternalEvent that has a registered Interrupt Handler for it
and which is pending to be sent to the relevant ThreadRun's.

fields.name: external_event_id
fields.description: The ID of the ExternalEvent triggering the Interrupt.

fields.name: handler_spec_name
fields.description: The name of the ThreadSpec to run to handle the Interrupt.

fields.name: interrupted_thread_id
fields.description:
The ID of the ThreadRun to interrupt. Must wait for this ThreadRun to be
HALTED before running the Interrupt Handler.

messages.name: PendingInterruptHaltReason
messages.description:
A Halt Reason denoting that a ThreadRun is halted while waiting for an Interrupt handler
to be run.

fields.name: external_event_id
fields.description: The ExternalEventId that caused the Interrupt.

messages.name: ThreadHaltReason
messages.description: Denotes a reason why a ThreadRun is halted. See `ThreadRun.halt_reasons` for context.

fields.name: parent_halted
fields.description: Parent threadRun halted.

fields.name: interrupted
fields.description: Handling an Interrupt.

fields.name: pending_interrupt
fields.description: Waiting to handle Interrupt.

fields.name: pending_failure
fields.description: Waiting to handle a failure.

fields.name: handling_failure
fields.description: Handling a failure.

fields.name: manual_halt
fields.description: Manually stopped the WfRun.

messages.name: ThreadRun
messages.description: A ThreadRun is a running thread of execution within a WfRun.

fields.name: wf_spec_id
fields.description:
The current WfSpecId of this ThreadRun. This must be set explicitly because
during a WfSpec Version Migration, it is possible for different ThreadSpec's to
have different WfSpec versions.

fields.name: number
fields.description:
The number of the ThreadRun. This is an auto-incremented integer corresponding to
the chronological ordering of when the ThreadRun's were created. If you have not
configured any retention policy for the ThreadRun's (i.e. never clean them up), then
this also corresponds to the position of the ThreadRun in the WfRun's `thread_runs`
list.

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of the ThreadRun.

fields.name: thread_spec_name
fields.description: The name of the ThreadSpec being run.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: The time the ThreadRun was started.

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: The time the ThreadRun was completed or failed. Unset if still active.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: error_message
fields.description: Human-readable error message detailing what went wrong in the case of a failure.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: child_thread_ids
fields.description: List of thread_run_number's for all child thread_runs.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: parent_thread_id
fields.description: Set for every ThreadRun except the ENTRYPOINT. This is the id of the parent thread.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: halt_reasons
fields.description:
If the ThreadRun is HALTED, this contains a list of every reason for which the
ThreadRun is HALTED. Once every reason is "resolved" (and thus removed from the list),
then the ThreadRun will return to the RUNNING state.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: interrupt_trigger_id
fields.description:
If this ThreadRun is of type INTERRUPT_HANDLER, this field is set to the ID of the
ExternalEvent that caused the Interrupt.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: failure_being_handled
fields.description:
If this ThreadRun is of type FAILURE_HANDLER, this field is set to the exact Failure
that is being handled by this ThreadRun.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: current_node_position
fields.description:
This is the current `position` of the current NodeRun being run. This is an
auto-incremented field that gets incremented every time we run a new NodeRun.

fields.name: handled_failed_children
fields.description:
List of every child ThreadRun which both a) failed, and b) was properly handled by a
Failure Handler.

This is important because at the EXIT node, if a Child ThreadRun was discovered to have
failed, then this ThreadRun (the parent) also fails with the same failure as the child.
If, however, a Failure Handler had previously "handled" the Child Failure, that ThreadRun's
number is appended to this list, and then the EXIT node ignores that ThreadRun.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: type
fields.description: The Type of this ThreadRun.

messages.name: WfRun
messages.description: A WfRun is a running instance of a WfSpec.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the WfRun.

fields.name: wf_spec_id
fields.description: The ID of the WfSpec that this WfRun belongs to.

fields.name: old_wf_spec_versions
fields.description:
When a WfRun is migrated from an old verison of a WfSpec to a newer one, we add the
old WfSpecId to this list for historical auditing and debugging purposes.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: status
fields.description: The status of this WfRun.

fields.name: greatest_threadrun_number
fields.description:
The ID number of the greatest ThreadRUn in this WfRun. The total number of ThreadRuns
is given by greatest_thread_run_number + 1.

Introduced now since with ThreadRun-level retention, we can't rely upon
thread_runs.size() to determine the number of ThreadRuns, as a ThreadRun is removed
from the thread_runs list once its retention period expires.

fields.name: start_time
fields.description: The time the WfRun was started.

fields.name: end_time
fields.description: The time the WfRun failed or completed.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: thread_runs
fields.description:
A list of all active ThreadRun's and terminated ThreadRun's whose retention periods
have not yet expired.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pending_interrupts
fields.description:
A list of Interrupt events that will fire once their appropriate ThreadRun's finish
halting.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: pending_failures
fields.description:
A list of pending failure handlers which will fire once their appropriate ThreadRun's
finish halting.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: var_def
fields.description: Future: Add index information (local/remote/etc)

fields.name: seconds_after_thread_termination
fields.description:
Delete associated ThreadRun's X seconds after they terminate, regardless
of status.

messages.name: ThrowEventNode
messages.description: A SubNode that throws a WorkflowEvent of a specific type.

fields.name: event_def_id
fields.description: The WorkflowEventDefId of the WorkflowEvent that is thrown

fields.name: content
fields.description: A VariableAssignment defining the content of the WorkflowEvent that is thrown

fields.name: user_group
fields.description: to whom should the User Task Run be assigned?
fields.label: optional

fields.name: actions
fields.description:
This is used to, for example, send a push notification to a mobile app
to remind someone that they need to fill out a task, or to re-assign
the task to another group of people
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: user_task_def_version
fields.description:
So, once the WfSpec is created, this will be pinned to a version. Customer
can optionally specify a specific version or can leave it null, in which
case we just use the latest
fields.label: optional

fields.name: notes
fields.description: Allow WfRun-specific notes for this User Task.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: on_cancellation_exception_name
fields.description: Specifies the name of the exception thrown when the User Task is canceled
fields.label: optional

fields.name: status
fields.description: to be used for WfSpec Status, i.e. ACTIVE/TERMINATING/ARCHIVED

fields.name: parent_wf_spec
fields.description:
Reference to the parent WfSpec. If this is set, all WfRun's for this WfSpec must be the
child of a WfRun belonging to the referenced WfSpec.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: ParentWfSpecReference
messages.description:
Reference to another WfSpec. If a WfSpec has a ParentWfSpecReference, then all
WfRun's for that WfSpec *MUST* be the child of a WfRun of the provided WfSpec; meaning
that the RunWf RPC must provide a `parent_wf_run_id` that belongs to the specified
WfSpec.

Currently, only reference by names is supported.

fields.name: wf_spec_name
fields.description: Name of the Parent WfSpec

fields.name: wf_spec_major_version
fields.description:
FOR NOW: no validation of variables on parent. In the future we will pass
wf_spec_major_version, but we should probably examine the rules for
evolution in the future.

fields.name: seconds_after_wf_termination
fields.description:
Delete all WfRun's X seconds after they terminate, regardless of
status.

messages.name: WorkflowEvent
messages.description:
A WorkflowEvent represents a "Thing That Happened" *INSIDE* a WfRun. It is DIFFERENT from
an ExternalEvent, because an ExternalEvent represents something that happened OUTSIDE the WfRun,
and is used to send information to the WfRun.

In contrast, a WorkflowEvent is thrown by the WfRun and is used to send information to the outside
world.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the WorkflowEvent. Contains WfRunId and WorkflowEventDefId.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The content of the WorkflowEvent.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: The time that the WorkflowEvent was created.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers  if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
